column4: Hey, can someone help me with the Card Reader ?? I need to copy my photographs to my PC..
Its basically that no action is happening when i connect the card reader... Is it not plug and play???
what type of card reader is it? in that I mean how does it connect to your computer, and what brand is it?
Its a Tech-com card reader which works on USB 2.0
have you googled for instructions on it? to help you with this that's what I'd be doing anyway...
I tried, cudnt find any instructions... are they there ???
I don't know, I guess I'll look. any model numbers you can give me?
Its a generic stuf.. not really a big brand..
either I'm reading this wrong, or they only have drivers for windows 98: http://www.techcomindia.com/home.php?vaction=download
Yeah, cuz after that it works plug and play... ;)
have you checked to make sure the usb port you're plugging it into is working correctly? what version of ubuntu are you running?
I'm running Hardy heron.. How do i check if the usb is workin ?? One thing is that the Tech-com thing is geting power.. What else do i check ??
USB is working cuz i can connect my printer to it. But the USB Card Reader is not getting recognized on ubuntu.
I don't know what to tell you - my card reader works - and it's plug and play, and I don't see any drivers or tutorials. sorry...
When u connect the card reader, what happens next ?? does it mount to /media or something else ??
I don't have a card here to test it with at the moment but iirc the slot shows up under Nautilus' "computer" view, and it pops up just like a usb flash drive would
Ok.. I'll see what i can do. Thanks..
